data.title: Classic Diner
data.text: Best pancakes and classic diner grub. They will whip up an adorable Mickey Mouse pancake for your little ones. LOVE THIS PLACE

data.title: Great Diner example
data.text:
First ample parking all around. Don't be afraid to either park directly behind the restaurant or on nearby surface streets. 

Hash browns - perfectly crisply.  Nice done. Soft inside.   Country Potatoes even better.

Diced ham and egg scramble - huge portion. You will not be hungry

Blueberry Pancake - superstar of the breakfast.  Tons of berries, light and fluffy, lots of flavor

Truly a neighborhood gem. Support this local coffee shop!

data.title: Good eats... fast service!
data.text: The Sugar Plum is a very popular spot in Concord. This is a very typical diner style restaurant from the 60's and 70's. Basic good grub and very fast service. Serving normal traditional breakfasts of eggs, sausage, bacon and potatoes. Sort of a " Greasy Spoon" but not sure that is a fair assessment of this place.

data.title: Best Greasy Spoon in town!
data.text: They only serve eggs Benedict on weekends but it is worth the wait! Really great food, very friendly staff, I love this dining establishment!

data.title: Old style corner breakfast place
data.text: This is a s close to a 1960's breakfast and lunch counter as you will find, likely because I don't thing they have remodeled since then.  They open early in the morning and are closed after lunch.  As traditional as you can get where you can start your day with variations on your eggs and beacon etc.  Nothing artisan here, just solid traditional food and plenty of it. Counter service, tables and booths.   Conveniently located with enough parking just a block south of Todos Santos Park and very close to Concord Bart station.

data.title: Old homey feeling shop
data.text: Small, feels like home I've been going there so long.  Best BLT w/ avacado!   Like to sit at counter where you can see them cooking your food.  A lot of regulars frequent Sugar Plum, and it's been in business for so long I can't remember it not being there.    Good place for breakfast too.   Sometimes parking can be a problem, but it's worth the walk to walk a block or two.

data.title: Great Old Fashioned Diner
data.text: The Sugar Plum has the best chicken fried steak around. They also make excellent omelets. My husband and I go there at least once a month for breakfast. Even when I have gone there for lunch I have breakfast. The lunch items look tasty too. The owner and employees are friendly and have been there a long time. It truly has a neighborhood diner feel to it.

data.title: Good hearty servings
data.text: Want a good hearty meal then stop by and enjoy a delicious breakfast.  The atmosphere is calm and the staff is lovely.

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: Sugar Plum has good food and happy friendly staff.   Great place for breadfast and lunch.   Clean and family owned.

data.title: MMM good and lots of food.
data.text: Looking downtown Concord, CA for a local breakfast/coffee shop and found the Sugar Plum. Prices were very reasonable and the plate was full. The corned beef hash was fantastic, eggs perfectly cooked and great home fried potatos. As more customers came in the waitress called them by name. Next time in the area will try their lunch specials.

data.title: If your hungry and downtown its not bad
data.text: food is good and the prices are not bad. Its a local gathering spot. Basic café fare. American and daily specials

data.title: Our family Breakfast favorite!
data.text: I have lived in Concord for over 60 years and Sugar Plum has always been around. Sugar Plum has survived earthquakes, a fire, change of ownership and is still standing. My dad took us there when I was young and we've been having breakfast there ever since. It still remains one of my favorite breakfast spots!

data.title: Down-home diner with great service & food.
data.text: Quick, good comfort food. Love the Eggs Benedicts on weekends. Country fried steak awesome. Biscuits & Gravy always a favorite.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Great breakfast, nice service.  A little small in terms of places to sit but the food is good!!  Closed for dinner

data.title: The best diner on the planet
data.text: The Sugar Spoon is not just an ld fashioned diner, it's a gathering place. You won't find nicer people or better food anywhere.

data.title: Been around forever and still the best in Concord.
data.text: Sugar Plum is this great hole in the wall. Just looking at it driving by you would probably pass it up. The exterior hasn't changed at all in the past 30 years. Current aren't original owners but they have kept the beat up with the original standards. Cook  to order your breakfast even have a great clam chowder on Friday. Try their weekend specials too. Friendly friendly owners and waitresses. More often then not there is a wait for a booth. They offer counter/bar service also. Oh year, best hash browns around!!

data.title: Great Food! It's like eating at a family members house!
data.text: Eating at Sugar Plum is like eating at grandmas house. It's very family oriented, you are always greeted with a smile and respect. The food is great! The breakfast food is very well served. The grilled cheese sandwiches are my kids favorite! My husband loves the French toast, and I think they have the best pancakes in the area. If you visit Concord CA. You can't miss this spot!

data.title: Sugar Plum Coffee Shop
data.text: Good place for Sunday brunch (or any other day for that matter).  Plenty of food and good service.  Parking can be a problem, but not on Sunday before 10:00 am.

data.title: Service, service, service
data.text: We have been eating at the Sugar Plum for about 4 years.  Usually the service is great.  Today, not so much.  Our waitress had some kind of attitude.  She never came back to our table to check and she never refilled our coffee and water.   I had to go to the counter for a refill.  She gave me one piece of toast instead of the two per the menu.  The second piece was still in the toaster and she threw it away.  We are not going back.

data.title: Fan favorite
data.text: If you want to get a feeling of old Concord. Visit this place. Great food, Great people, Great experiance each visit.
